title: Bart De Wever - Wikipedia
snippet: Bart Albert Liliane De Wever (Dutch: [ˈbɑrt də ˈʋeːvər]; born 21 December 1970) is a Belgian politician who has served as the Prime Minister of Belgium since February 2025. From 2004 to 2025, De Wever had been the leader of the New Flemish Alliance (N-VA), a political party advocating for the transformation of Belgium into a confederal state.

title: Prime Minister of Belgium - Wikipedia
snippet: In 1790, the Sovereign Congress of the States of Belgium sat in Brussels and was composed of representatives from each of the eight provinces. title: Alexander De Croo - Wikipedia
snippet: De Croo remained as caretaker prime minister until the new government was formed on 3 February 2025, being succeeded by Bart De Wever, leader of the N-VA. Alexander De Croo was born on 3 November 1975 in Vilvoorde in Flemish Brabant, Belgium, and was one of two children of the politician and ...

title: Flemish nationalist Bart De Wever sworn in as Belgium's new prime minister
snippet: He takes over from outgoing prime minister Alexander De Croo, whose seven-party coalition took an arduous 493 days to emerge back in 2019-2020. De Croo had stayed on as caretaker leader after the June elections.

title: Biography | Bart De Wever
snippet: 2025 - present: Prime Minister, titular Mayor of Antwerp 2013 - 2025: Mayor of Antwerp 2004 - 2025: Party Chairman of the N-VA 2024 - 2025, 2014 - 2019, 2007 - 2009: Federal Member of Parliament 2019 - 2024, 2009 - 2014, 2004 - 2007: Flemish Member of Parliament 2007 - present, 2000 - 2004: Municipal Councillor in Antwerp 1996 - 1997: District Councillor in Berchem 1995 - 2001: Researcher and academic staff member in history at KU Leuven ... Bart De Wever was born on 21 December 1970.
